Package uiClasses

Class CmdLineUi

java.lang.Object
uiClasses.CmdLineUi
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameUi
public class CmdLineUi
extends java.lang.Object
implements GameUi
Represents Command Line UI for playing 'Island Trader' game
Since:
26/4/21
Version:
17/5/21
Author:
Hugo Phibbs and Jordan Vegar

    • setup

      public void setup​(GameEnvironment gameEnvironment)
      Gets the input required to create the player and ship objects, then passes them to gameEnvironment to complete its setup.
      Specified by:

      Parameters:
      gameEnvironment - GameEnvironment object for the current object

    • playGame

      public void playGame()
      While the game has not been finished, playGame calls methods to print the actions available to the player, take input from the player and handles that input to perform actions.
      Specified by:
      playGame in interface GameUi

    • finishGame

      public void finishGame​(java.lang.String message)
      Method for finishing a game, prints messages detailing the game just played. I.e. displays days survived, profit made and the final score
      Specified by:
      finishGame in interface GameUi
      Parameters:
      message - String detailing the reason why a game ended

    • pirateAttack

      public void pirateAttack​(Route route)
      Method to perform a Pirate attack onto a user. Prints a stream of information detailing the current progress of the attack
      Specified by:
      pirateAttack in interface GameUi
      Parameters:
      route - Route The route the player was sailing along when the pirate attack occurred.

    • badWeather

      public void badWeather​(Route route, int damageDone)
      Description copied from interface: GameUi
      Method to display output describing a bad weather random event to the user.
      Specified by:
      badWeather in interface GameUi
      Parameters:
      route - Route The route the player was sailing along when the bad weather occurred
      damageDone - int The amount of damage the weather dealt to your ship.
